sentence.Network_en: A bright shooting star, or meteor, is an unforgettable sight.
sentence.Network_cn: 明亮的流星，或者说陨石，是番难忘的景象。

sentence.Network_en: Every person stood to applaud his unforgettable act of courage.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有人起立为他不可磨灭的英勇之举鼓掌。

sentence.Network_en: A visit to the Museum is an unforgettable experience.
sentence.Network_cn: 参观博物馆是一段令人难忘的经历。

entry.def: If you describe something as unforgettable, you mean that it is, for example, extremely beautiful, enjoyable, or unusual, so that you remember it for a long time. You can also refer to extremely unpleasant things as unforgettable .

example.ex: A visit to the Museum is an unforgettable experience...
example.tran: 参观博物馆是一段令人难忘的经历。

example.ex: A bright shooting star, or meteor, is an unforgettable sight.
example.tran: 明亮的流星，或者说陨石，是番难忘的景象。

auth_sentence.content: One of the many highlights of another unforgettable season.
auth_sentence.res_content: One of the many highlights of another unforgettable season.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One of the many highlights of another unforgettable season.

auth_sentence.content: Moreover, a single big coincidence is unforgettable.
auth_sentence.res_content: Moreover, a single big coincidence is unforgettable.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Moreover, a single big coincidence is unforgettable.

auth_sentence.content: That's an unforgettable experience, she says.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That's an unforgettable experience, she says.

means.word_mean: (经历)难以忘怀的;不会被遗忘的

sentences.en: The trip had been unforgettable experience for both of us.
sentences.cn: 那趟旅行是我们两人难以忘怀的经历。
